title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MIAMI — On a night when the hardwood floor of Miami Arena felt more like a stage for a one-man offensive clinic, Kevin Garnett authored a performance for the ages. The Minnesota Timberwolves, carried on the broad shoulders of their young phenom, outlasted the Miami Heat 95-87 in a defensive grind that was utterly dominated by one historic, singular force.

Garnett wasn’t just the best player on the floor; he was a whirlwind of efficiency and power, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 40 points. He was unstoppable, shooting a blistering 17-for-32 from the field and a perfect 6-for-6 from the free-throw line. But his dominance didn’t stop at scoring. He completed a breathtaking stat line, ripping down 13 rebounds, dishing out 5 assists, and swatting away 3 Miami shots, leaving the Heat with no answer.

While Garnett orchestrated the masterpiece, the Heat scrambled for a counterpoint. Tim Hardaway led Miami with 21 points, but it was a quiet 21, a testament to the Timberwolves’ defensive focus elsewhere. The Heat’s offense never found a consistent rhythm, shooting just 40.8% from the field as a team.

This was not merely a victory for the Timberwolves; it was a coronation. In a game defined by grit and defense, Kevin Garnett transcended the contest, delivering a performance so complete and so powerful that it instantly etched his name deeper into the NBA record books and announced his arrival as one of the league’s most unstoppable forces.
